intro: Lastreopsis pubescens, commonly known as the hairy lastreopsis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, often glandular leaves and small, white to yellowish flowers that bloom in umbels. Native to southern Africa, this plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. The plant's structure is compact, with a short, upright stem and foliage that is densely covered in fine hairs. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
